form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Ernst (for herself, Mrs. Britt, and Mr. Grassley) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to improve the calculation and reduce the taxpayer cost of payment errors under the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Snap Back Inaccurate SNAP Payments Act.

section.header: Quality control system tolerance level for excluding small errors
section.text: Section 16(c) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(c)) is amended—

clause.text: in subclause (I), by striking and at the end;

subclause.text: by inserting through fiscal year 2024 after thereafter; and
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, $0.

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking may and inserting shall;
in clause (ii)(I), by inserting , as adjusted under subparagraph (H), if applicable after agency; and
in clause (iii), by striking 10 and inserting 25; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Reduction of payment error rate based on percentage of overpayments recouped
subparagraph.text: In determining the liability amount of a State agency under subparagraph (C) for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, the payment error rate described in clause (ii)(I) of that subparagraph shall be equal to the product obtained by multiplying—

clause.text: the payment error rate of the State agency for that fiscal year; and
the percentage of the total amount of overpayments of benefits made by the State agency that are not recouped by the State agency under paragraph (9) for that fiscal year.

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (9) as paragraph (10); and
by inserting after paragraph (8) the following:
Each State agency shall seek to recoup any overpayments of benefits made to benefit recipients.
